get.description:
Auto generate option types are used to auto generate the batch or serial numbers associated with the product that exist within the application. Products can be 'No automatic number generation', 'Use sequence numbers', 'Use date and sequence numbers' or 'Use order number and sequence number'.

The API endpoint returns details of the auto generate option types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the auto generate option types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Fulfilment sequence types are the sequence options for the fulfilment methods used for product allocation which determines how products are allocated to sales orders within the application. Products can sequenced by 'Bin Priority', 'Smallest Quantity First', 'Largest Quantity First', 'Oldest Sell By Date', 'Oldest Use By Date' or 'FIFO'.

The API endpoint returns details of the fulfilment sequence types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the fulfilment sequence types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Fulfilment method types are the method of fulfilment for your products on sales orders. This determines how the products are allocated. Fulfmilment methods are 'From Stock', 'From Supplier Via Stock' and 'Direct To Customer'.

The API endpoint returns details of the fulfilment method types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the fulfilment method types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:

get.description:
Products are used to track stock within Sage 200. This is not just for physical items, but also for items that are ordered direct from suppliers, services, and time or labour that can be included on customer invoices.

Each stock item has default settings that are used each time the item is bought or sold. Some of these are inherited from the product group and some are set on each item.

If stock setting UseMultipleLocations is true, you must specify warehouse holding(s) when creating products.

If stock setting UseMultipleLocations is false, then new product will be automatically linked to the default (home) warehouse.

200.description: The details of the products have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Memos are sections of text that can be used to make comments about a product.

Multiple memos can be added to each product. The user that created the memo, the date it was created and last updated date and time are also recorded.

A user can also specify if a memo is currently 'Active' or 'Inactive'. This allows a user to keep a record of previous memos without deleting them.

200.description: The list of product memos has been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

Items with a type of 'Stock' have levels recorded for each warehouse location and the levels are used when allocating, issuing and receiving stock.

get.description:
Stocktake traceable types are used to select stock items by stock traceable type to be included on a stocktake. Selection can be on 'Non-Traceable', 'Serial Numbered', 'Batch Numbered' or 'Batch and Serial'.

The API endpoint returns details of the traceable types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the stocktake traceable types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Stocktake selector value types are used to select stock items by stock value to be included on a stocktake. Stocktake selector value types can be either 'Average buying price' or 'Value of stock'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake selector value types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the stocktake selector value types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description: Gets the collection of stocktakes including warehouse name. The default sort (orderby) field is by 'stocktake_name' ascending.

200.description: The details of the stocktakes have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Stocktake method for selecting stocktake items. Stocktake type can be 'By Stock Item', or 'By Bin'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the stocktake types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Stocktake status types describe the possible states in which a stocktake can be. Stocktake status type can be 'No stocktake', 'Selecting items', 'Sheets printed', 'Entering counts', or 'Complete'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake status types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the stocktake status types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

get.description:
Discrepancy status types describe the possible states of a stocktake discrepancy. Discrepancy status type can be 'No Discrepancy', 'Discrepancy Found', or 'Discrepancy Resolved'.

The API endpoint returns details of the discrepancy status types that can be used.

200.description: The details of the discrepancy status types have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

bom_cost_heading_type.description: The list of different cost heading types. When calculating the cost of BOMs, estimates or works orders, the values are accumulated in a cost heading.

bom_cost_heading.description: When calculating the cost of BOMs, estimates or works orders, the values are accumulated in a cost heading.

product.description:
Products are used to track stock within Sage 200. This is not just for physical items, but also for items that are ordered direct from suppliers, services, and time or labour that can be included on customer invoices.

Each stock item has default settings that are used each time the item is bought or sold. Some of these are inherited from the product group and some are set on each item.

Note: When creating products via the API, each product is assigned to a warehouse. If the stock setting UseMultipleLocations is true then multiple warehouse holdings can be specified. You cannot delete the last warehouse holding associated with a product.

use_description_on_documents.description: Whether to use the product description on order and invoice documents.

allow_sales_order.description: Indicates whether the product is allowed on sales orders and invoicing.

free_stock_quantity.description: The quantity of free stock available.

fulfilment_method_type.description: The fulfilment method type of the product.

fulfilment_sequence_type.description: The fulfilment sequence type of the product.

inactivation_date.description: If the product was made inactive, the date on which the product was made inactive.

label_printing_option_type.description: The label printing option type. (Sage 200 Professional only).

traceable_type.description: The traceable type of the product. (Sage 200 Professional only).

sale_from_single_batch.description: Indicates whether the product is sold from a single batch. (Sage 200 Professional only).

allow_duplicate_numbers.description: Indicates whether the product allows duplicate numbers. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_alternative_ref.description: Indicates whether the product uses alternative references. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_sell_by_date.description: Indicates whether the product uses sell by dates. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_use_by_date.description: Indicates whether the product uses use by dates. (Sage 200 Professional only).

shelf_life.description: The shelf life of the product. (Sage 200 Professional only).

shelf_life_type.description: The shelf life type of the product. (Sage 200 Professional only).

record_nos_on_goods_received.description: Indicates whether the product is assigned batch/serial numbers when received. (Sage 200 Professional only).

include_nos_on_count_sheets.description: Indicates whether the products batch/serial numbers are displayed on stocktake sheets. (Sage 200 Professional only).

auto_generate_option_type.description: The auto generate option of the product. (Sage 200 Professional only).

auto_generate_prefix.description: Products auto generated prefix. (Sage 200 Professional only).

auto_generate_padding.description: Products auto generated padding. (Sage 200 Professional only).

stocktake_cycle_period.description: The period of time in days between each stocktake of the product.

standard_cost.description: The standard cost of the product, if the product group uses the Standard costing method.

average_buying_price.description: The average buying price of the product, if the product group uses either the FIFO or Average costing method.

landed_costs_per_item.description: The amount of the product's cost which is landed costs (if the landed costs type is Value Based).

bom_item_type.description: The BOM item type of the product.

stock_unit.description: The products stock unit of measure.

alternative_products.description: Alternative products are suitable products that can be offered when a requested product is unavailable. An alternative product can be the preferred alternative for a product. When stock is issued for a sales order, if the product is unavailable, the preferred alternative can be chosen, if stock is available.

cross_sell_products.description: Cross sell products are complimentary products which are often sold together with another product. For example, if you sell a printer, you might want to show print cartridges or cables for that printer. Cross sell products can help speed up entering a full sales order.

memos.description:
Memos are sections of text that can be used to make comments about a product.

Multiple memos can be added to each product. The user that created the memo, the date it was created and last updated date and time are also recorded.

A user can also specify if a memo is currently 'Active' or 'Inactive'. This allows a user to keep a record of previous memos without deleting them.

search_category_values.description:
Search categories are used to help you search for stock items without knowing the item's stock code.

A search category consists of:
  • A category. This is the type such as colour, size or voltage.
  • A value. This is the specifics of the category such as green, red and blue for the category colour.
Search categories are inherited from the product group.

suppliers.description: Product suppliers are used to record suppliers of products. The supplier details are used when creating purchase orders. A supplier can be the preferred supplier for a product. The preferred supplier details are suggested when entering a purchase order for the product.

warehouse_holdings.description:
If stock setting UseMultipleLocations is true, you must specify warehouse holding(s) when creating products.

If stock setting UseMultipleLocations is false, then new product will be automatically linked to the default (home) warehouse.

product_status_type.description:
Product status types are used to identify when a product can have a stock movement recorded against it within the application. Products can be 'Active' or 'Inactive'.

The API endpoint returns details of the product status types that can be used.

product_group_search_category_value.description: This API endpoint returns a list of the allowed values for a product group search category.

prod_group_search_val_id.description: Product group search value record Id.

bom_item_type.description:
Bill of materials item types are used to identify how this product will be used in a bill of materials within the application. Products can be 'Component', 'Subassembly', 'Phantom' or 'Built/Bought'.

The API endpoint returns details of the bill of materials item types that can be used.

bom_settings.description: A group of BOM related settings for a product.

built_bought_default_make.description: Reflects BOM Details Built/Bought selection. True if Default Built. False if Default Bought.

scrap_percent.description: Scrap percentage figure to apply when processing components in Manufacturing.

bulk_issue.description: Indicates whether to handle stock movements manually for the component.

cost_heading_id.description: Cost heading record Id associated with the product.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

traceable_type.description:
Traceable types are used to identify the different traceable options of the product that exist within the application. Products can be 'Non-Traceable', 'Serial Numbered' or 'Batch Numbered'.

The API endpoint returns details of the traceable types that can be used.

product_type.description:
Product types are used to identify the different types of product that exist within the application. Products can be 'Stock', 'Miscellaneous' or 'Service/Labour'.

The API endpoint returns details of the product types that can be used.

auto_generate_option_type.description:
Auto generate option types are used to auto generate the batch or serial numbers associated with the product that exist within the application. Products can be 'No automatic number generation', 'Use sequence numbers', 'Use date and sequence numbers' or 'Use order number and sequence number'.

The API endpoint returns details of the auto generate option types that can be used.

fulfilment_method_type.description:
Fulfilment methods types are the method options for fulfilling stock on sales orders. It determines how stock items are allocated to sales orders. The fulfilment methods are 'From Stock', 'Supplier Via Stock' and 'Direct to Customer'.

The API endpoint returns details of the fulfilment method types that can be used.

fulfilment_sequence_type.description:
Fulfilment sequence types are the sequence options for the fulfilment methods used for product allocation which determines how products are allocated to sales orders within the application. Products can sequenced by 'Bin Priority', 'Smallest Quantity First', 'Largest Quantity First', 'Oldest Sell By Date', 'Oldest Use By Date' or 'FIFO'.

The API endpoint returns details of the fulfilment sequence types that can be used.

label_printing_option_type.description:
Label printing option types used to determine how to print order lablels. The label printing option types are 'Label not required', 'Label required per item' and 'Label required per batch'.

The API endpoint returns details of the label printing option types that can be used.

auto_generate_separator.description:
Auto generate separators are used to auto generate the batch or serial numbers associated with the product that exist within the application. Auto generate separators can be 'None', 'Space', 'Colon', 'Forward Slash', 'Backward Slash', 'Dot' or 'Hyphen'.

The API endpoint returns details of the auto generate option types that can be used.

name.description: The name of the auto generate separator.

separator_character.description: The separator character of the auto generate separator.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

product_transaction_group_type.description:
Product transaction group types are used to group the different (secondary) movement types of the product within the application. Product transaction group types can be 'Allocation' ,'Goods Out' ,'Goods In' ,'On POP Order'.

The API endpoint returns details of the product transaction group types that can be used.

product_transaction_type.description: Product transaction types are used to identify the different types of product movement transactions. These transactions are created when products are moved in and out of stock and, can be from various sources such as purchase orders or sales orders.

product_transaction_view.description: A product transaction is created each time a product is moved in, or out of stock. Product transactions are created from various sources such as purchase orders, sales orders, transfers between warehouses etc.. This resource returns the details of product transactions. The default sort (orderby) field is by 'Id' descending.

transaction_type.description: Enum value of the transaction_type_id that describes the transaction that created the product movement.

source_area_reference.description: The code of the source of the transaction.

source_area_name.description: The name of the source of the transaction.

reference.description: This can be an optional reference added to the transaction by the user, or an automatically generated reference such as the order number.

second_reference.description: This can be an additional optional reference added to the transaction by the user, or an automatically generated reference such as the despatch note number.

warehouse_name.description: The warehouse the product was moved from or to.

bin_name.description: The name of the bin to which the transaction relates to.

unit_cost_price.description: The cost price per unit for this transaction.

unit_issue_price.description: The price used when products are moved out of stock.

unit_discount_value.description: The discount amount per unit used for this transaction.

total_order_discount.description: The total discount value of the transaction.

issue_value.description: The total issue or sales price of the transaction.

memo.description: Any memo note that was applied to the product transaction.

user_name.description: The name of the Sage 200 user that created the transaction.

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

product_transaction_traceable_item_histo.description: This resource returns traceable item details for a product traceable history record. (Sage 200 Professional only).

identification_no.description: The identification number of the traceable item.

additional_reference.description: The additional reference for the traceable item.

sell_by_date.description: The sell by date of the traceable item.

use_by_date.description: The use by date of the traceable item.

bin_name.description: The bin name within the warehouse of the allocation of a product.

costing_method_type.description:
Costing method types are used to calculate the cost of sales from your sales orders, the value of stock and the transactions posted to your stock nominal accounts within the application. Product groups can be 'FIFO', 'Average', 'Standard' or 'Actual'.

The API endpoint returns details of the costing method types that can be used.

landed_costs_type.description:
Landed costs refer to any costs associated with the shipping, handling and importing of stock items on purchase orders. These additional costs are often invoiced separately, for example, by a courier. Landed costs type can be 'Not Applicable', 'Percentage Based', or 'Value Based'.

The API endpoint returns details of the costing method types that can be used.

product_group.description: Product groups are used to group stock items together with similar characteristics or requirements. Product Groups provide several default settings for stock items and have their own unique code and description.

code.description: The code of the product group.

description.description: The description of the product group.

product_type.description: The product type of the product group.

costing_method.description: The costing method of the product group.

stocktake_cycle_period.description: The default period of time in days between each stocktake for products in the product group.

label_printing_option_type.description: The label printing option type. (Sage 200 Professional only).

keep_movement_history.description: Whether to keep a record of historical stock movements for products in the product group. (Sage 200 Professional only).

can_levels_go_negative.description: Indicates whether to allow stock levels to go negative. (Sage 200 Professional only).

can_over_allocate_negative_stock.description: Whether to allocate the full quantity of stock on an order by default, even if the stock level would become negative.

use_description_on_documents.description: Whether to use the product description on order and invoice documents.

use_reverse_charge_vat_rules.description: Whether the product is subject to domestic reverse charge VAT rules.

do_items_use_units.description: Indicates whether items in the product group use additional units. (Sage 200 Professional only).

this_is_the_sop_product_group.description: Indicates whether this is the SOP product group.

selling_quantities_use_multiple_units.description: Indicates whether selling quantities use multiple units. (Sage 200 Professional only).

selling_prices_use_multiple_units.description: Indicates whether selling prices use multiple units. (Sage 200 Professional only).

buying_quantities_use_multiple_units.description: Indicates whether buying quantities use multiple units. (Sage 200 Professional only).

buying_prices_use_multiple_units.description: Indicates whether buying prices use multiple units. (Sage 200 Professional only).

do_items_use_markup.description: Indicates whether markup pricing is used.

use_landed_costs.description: Whether products in the product group will use landed costs by default.

landed_costs_type.description: The default landed costs type for products in the product group.

landed_costs_percentage.description: The percentage of the cost of the product which is landed costs, if the landed costs type is Percentage Based.

landed_costs_per_item.description: The amount of the cost of the product which is landed costs, if the landed costs type is Value Based.

traceable_type.description: The traceable type of the product group. (Sage 200 Professional only).

sale_from_single_batch.description: Indicates whether the product is sold from a single batch. (Sage 200 Professional only).

allow_duplicate_numbers.description: Indicates whether the product allows duplicate numbers. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_alternative_ref.description: Indicates whether the product uses alternative references. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_sell_by_date.description: Indicates whether the product uses sell by dates. (Sage 200 Professional only).

uses_use_by_date.description: Indicates whether the product uses use by dates. (Sage 200 Professional only).

accrual_nominal_code_id.description: Accrual nominal code record Id. (Sage 200 Professional only).

issue_nominal_code_id.description: Issue nominal code record Id. (Sage 200 Professional only).

accrual_nominal_code.description: The products accrual nominal code. (Sage 200 Professional only).

issue_nominal_code.description: The products issue nominal code. (Sage 200 Professional only).

search_categories.description:
The product group search categories. Search categories are used to help you search for stock items without knowing the item's stock code.

A search category consists of:
  • A category. This is the type such as colour, size or voltage.
Product group search categories only consists of a category.

units.description: The product group units of measure.

bom_settings.description: A group of BOM related settings for the product group.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

product_group_bom_settings.description: The BOM related settings for the product group

cost_heading_id.description: The product group default cost heading record Id.

cost_heading.description: The product group default cost heading.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

product_group_search_category.description: The search categories for the product group.

id.description: Product group search category record Id.

product_group_id.description: The associated product group record Id.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

product_group_unit.description: The units of measure in which products are stored as well as those used when buying or selling products.

product_group_id.description: The associated product group record Id.

unit_type.description: The unit type of the unit of measure.

use_own_price.description: Whether the product group unit uses specific pricing.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

id.description: The search category value record Id.

search_category_id.description: The Id of the search category to which this search value belongs.

is_none_value.description: Flag indicating if this item is the 'None' value for a list of related search category values.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

product_search.description: Returns matching products associated with the search category values passed.

show_inactive.description: Whether products that are inactive are included.

show_phantom.description: Whether products that are phantom items are included.

show_only_allow_sales_order.description: Whether to show only products that are allowed for sales orders.

product_search_type.description: The product search type is used to decide what filter of products is applied.

Product search types.

The API endpoint returns details of the product search types that can be used.

product_search_search_category_value.description: The product search request of search category values.

product_search_matching_product.description: The product search response of matching products.

product_type.description: The product type of the product group.

free_stock_quantity.description: The quantity of free stock available.

unit_type.description:
Unit types are used to indicate the unit of measure type within the application. The types can be 'Base', 'Stock' or 'Additional'.

The API endpoint returns details of the unit of measure types that can be used.

lookup_product_group.description: A subset of product group information for populating a lookup.

code.description: The code of the product group.

description.description: The description of the product group.

product_type_id.description: The product type of the product group.

lookup_product.description: A subset of product information for populating a lookup.

free_stock_quantity.description: The quantity of free stock of the product.

record_nos_on_goods_received.description: Indicates whether this product is assigned batch/serial numbers when received.

product_status_id.description: The product status type of the product.

bom_item_type_id.description: The bill of materials item type of the product.

traceable_type_id.description: The traceable type of the product.

this_is_the_sop_product_group.description: Indicates whether this product is associated with a product group that is only to be used in Sales Order Processing.

product_type_id.description: The product type of the product.

allow_sales_order.description: Indicates whether the product is allowed on sales orders and invoicing.

lookup_stock_item_unit.description: A subset of stock item unit information for populating a lookup.

name.description: The name of the stock item unit.

stock_transfer_traceable_items_request.description: Returns a list of traceable items for a product and bin.

bin_holding_from_id.description: Bin holding record Id for the product location.

stock_transfer.description: A stock transfer is used to move stock from one location to another.

bin_holding_from_id.description: Bin holding record Id for the source location.

bin_holding_to_id.description: Bin holding record Id for the destination location.

quantity.description: Adjustment quantity. Only used for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeBatch.

is_selected.description: Whether the traceable item is selected for processing. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

identification_no.description: The identification number of the traceable item.

is_selectable.description: Whether the traceable item may be selected for processing. Typically unassigned items, or pre-receipts are not selectable.

supplier_reference.description: Supplier account reference. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

receipt_date.description: Received date. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

additional_reference.description: The additional reference for the traceable item.

sell_by_date.description: The sell by date of the traceable item.

use_by_date.description: The use by date of the traceable item.

bin_name.description: The bin name within the warehouse of the allocation of a product.

allocated_quantity.description: The allocated quantity of the allocation record.

is_allocated.description: Whether the traceable item is allocated. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

stock_transfer_response.description: A stock transfer is used to move stock from one location to another.

cross_sell_product_view.description: This specifies a lookup linking products with products that it can be cross sold with.

cross_sell_product_id.description: Product Id of the cross sell product.

cross_sell_product_code.description: Product code of the cross sell product.

cross_sell_product_name.description: Product name of the cross sell product.

cross_sell_product_group_id.description: Product group Id of the cross sell product.

cross_sell_product_status_type_id.description: Product status type Id of the cross sell product.

cross_sell_product_traceable_type_id.description: The traceable type Id of the cross sell product.

alternative_product_view.description: This specifies a lookup linking products with products that are an alternative for it.

alternative_product_id.description: Product Id of the alternative product.

alternative_product_code.description: Product code of the alternative product.

alternative_product_name.description: Product name of the alternative product.

alternative_product_group_id.description: Product group Id of the alternative product.

alternative_product_status_type_id.description: Product status type Id of the alternative product.

alternative_product_traceable_type_id.description: The traceable type Id of the alternative product.

is_preferred.description: Whether the alternative product is the preferred alternative for the product.

serial_allocated_to_who_type.description:
The serial allocated to who type, used to determine the type of allocation of a serial number.

The API endpoint returns the following values: EnumSerialAllocatedToWhoNot, EnumSerialAllocatedToWhoThis, EnumSerialAllocatedToWhoOther.

stock_settings.description: The Stock Settings are used to choose how to process and manage your stock.

use_multiple_locations.description: When true this setting allows Sage 200 to track stock at different locations. This can be across several warehouses, or a single warehouse split into separate areas (bins). (Sage 200 Standard value is true and cannot be changed).

use_search_categories.description: Allow searching using search categories and values to search for products using a list of search categories and values. (Sage 200 Standard value is false and cannot be changed).

integrate_stock_management_with_nominal.description: Integrate stock management with the Nominal Ledger allowing postings to the Nominal Ledger for stock movements and adjustments recorded in Stock Control. (Sage 200 Standard value is false and cannot be changed).

generate_cos_for_sop.description: Generate cost of sales postings from sales orders generated by Sales Order Processing. (Sage 200 Standard value is false and cannot be changed).

allow_negative_stocktake.description: Allow inclusion of stock items in stocktake that have negative stock levels. (Sage 200 Standard value is true and cannot be changed).

allow_negative_stocktake_with_purchase_o.description: Allow inclusion of stock items in stocktake that have negative stock levels with outstanding purchase orders. (Sage 200 Standard value is true and cannot be changed).

profit_percent_of_revenue.description: Profit can be calculated as a percentage of revenue (true), or as a percentage of cost (false).

record_numbers_on_goods_received.description: Whether to record traceable items when goods are received. (Sage 200 Professional only, Sage 200 Standard value is false and cannot be changed).

allocate_individual_items.description: Batch/serial numbers must be recorded when goods are received to assign batch/serial numbers to traceable items during the goods in process. (Sage 200 Standard value is numbers must be recorded when allocating stock and cannot be changed).

allow_fulfilment_from_stock.description: Allows a stock item to have a fulfilment method of 'from stock'.

allow_fulfilment_from_supplier_via_stock.description: Allows a stock item to have a fulfilment method of 'for delivery direct from supplier'.

allow_fulfilment_from_supplier_direct_to.description: Allows a stock item to have a fulfilment method of 'direct to customer' (Sage 200 Standard value is false and cannot be changed).

use_landed_costs.description: Whether or not to use landed costs.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

internal_area.description: The internal areas represent departments such as sales, retail and production. Use them to monitor stock issued for internal use.

is_default.description: Whether the internal area is the default area.

nominal_code_id.description: Internal area nominal record Id. (Sage 200 Professional only).

nominal_code.description: Internal area nominal code. (Sage 200 Professional only).

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

warehouse.description: All stock within Sage 200, regardless of type (Stock, Service/labour, or Miscellaneous), requires a holding location. By default, the HOME warehouse is created within Sage 200, you can then create your own warehouses.

use_for_sales_trading.description: Indicates that the warehouse is used for sales trading (Sage 200 Professional only).

bom_settings.description: The BOM related settings for the warehouse.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

warehouse_bom_settings.description: The BOM related settings for the warehouse

is_component_source.description: Allows the warehouse to be available in BOM processes such as trial kitting, allocation and building items (Sage 200 Professional only).

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

buying_price.description: The specific buying price at which a stock item was received.

number_of_movements.description: Number of movement receipts at this buying price.

is_buying_price_confirmed.description: Has this buying price been confirmed?.

buying_prices.description: A collection of stock movement receipts at this buying price.

movement_buying_price.description: Object representing receipt of a level of stock at a specific buying price.

date.description: Date the stock item was received.

stock_item_unit_name.description: Stock item unit of measure name.

warehouse_holding.description:
All stock within Sage 200 regardless of type (Stock, Service/labour, or Miscellaneous), require a holding location. The location indicates where an item is stored and the stock level settings for each product in the warehouse i.e. the re-order level, the minimum and maximum stock levels.

Items with a type of 'Stock' have levels recorded for each warehouse location and the levels are used when allocating, issuing and receiving stock.

If the stock setting UseMultipleLocations is true, a product can be linked to multiple warehouse holdings. You cannot delete the last warehouse holding associated with a product.

is_default_manufacturing_warehouse.description: True if the item is a built or built/bought item and that warehouse is marked as the default manufacturing warehouse; otherwise false.

quantity_in_stock.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity.

quantity_in_stock_less_reserved.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus reserved quantity.

quantity_allocated.description: Total allocated stock, SOP and bom quantity.

free_stock_available.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus allocated quantity.

free_stock_available_less_reserved.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus allocated and reserved quantities.

is_to_delete.description: When updating an existing product, whether to delete this warehouse holding from the collection of product warehouse holdings.

bin_holdings.description: The stock holding details for each bin in the warehouse.

delete_exception_type.description: The exception type thrown when attempting to remove a warehouse which cannot be removed.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

traceable_adjustment_item_balance.description: This resource returns traceable item balances for a warehouse holding of a product. (Sage 200 Professional only).

identification_no.description: The identification number of the traceable item.

supplier_reference.description: Supplier account reference. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

receipt_date.description: Received date. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

additional_reference.description: The additional reference for the traceable item.

sell_by_date.description: The sell by date of the traceable item.

use_by_date.description: The use by date of the traceable item.

bin_name.description: The bin name within the warehouse of the allocation of a product.

allocated_quantity.description: The allocated quantity of the allocation record.

is_allocated.description: Whether the traceable item is allocated. Only for products of traceable type EnumTraceableTypeSerial.

bin_holding.description: Bins allow you to specify a place in a Warehouse where stock is stored such as a shelf or aisle. Every Warehouse has a single Bin created by default called 'Unspecified'. If you don't want to use bins with your warehouses, all items are stored in the 'Unspecified' bin. You can rename the 'Unspecified' bin to something more meaningful for your company.

quantity_in_stock.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity.

quantity_in_stock_less_reserved.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus reserved quantity.

quantity_allocated.description: Total allocated stock, SOP and bom quantity.

free_stock_available.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus allocated quantity.

free_stock_available_less_reserved.description: Total confirmed and unconfirmed stock quantity minus allocated and reserved quantities.

last_stocktake.description: The date and time of the last stocktake for this item at this bin.

is_to_delete.description: When updating an existing warehouse holding, whether to delete this bin holding from the collection of warehouse holding bin holdings.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

traceable_adjustment.description: A traceable adjustment describes the traceable items which take part in Stock adjustments. (Sage 200 Professional only).

issue_status.description: The issue status type. This is used for filtering when amending batch/serial numbers.

identification_no.description: The identification number of the traceable item.

additional_reference.description: The additional reference for the traceable item.

sell_by_date.description: The sell by date of the traceable item.

use_by_date.description: The use by date of the traceable item.

warehouse_name.description: The name of the warehouse at which the traceable item is kept.

bin_name.description: The name of the bin at which the traceable item is kept.

supplier_reference.description: The supplier reference for traceable items which were recieved from POP order.

purchase_order_no.description: The purchase order number for traceable items which were recieved from POP order.

activity_date.description: The date of the traceable movement activity.

additional_reference.description: The additional reference for the traceable item.

sell_by_date.description: The sell by date of the traceable item.

use_by_date.description: The use by date of the traceable item.

traceable_items_assign_traceable_items_r.description: Returns a list of unassigned traceable items for a product.

traceable_items_amend_traceable_items_re.description: Returns a list of assigned traceable items for a product that can be amended.

product_duplicate_flags.description: Returns a duplicate product using the product options specified.

locations.description: Indicates whether to duplicate locations for the product.

location_stocking_levels.description: Indicates whether to duplicate warehouse stocking levels for the product.

units.description: Indicates whether to duplicate units of measure for the product (Sage 200 Professional only).

alternative_items.description: Indicates whether to duplicate alternative items for the product.

cross_selling_items.description: Indicates whether to duplicate cross-selling items for the product.

attachments.description: Indicates whether to duplicate attachments for the product.

memos.description: Indicates whether to duplicate memos for the product.

suppliers.description: Indicates whether to duplicate suppliers for the product.

product_warehouse_bin_view.description: This resource returns a view of warehouses and bins for a product. This view filters out the return and direct delivery warehouses. The default sort (orderby) field are by 'warehouse_name' and 'bin_holding_name' ascending.

product_warehouse_view.description: This resource returns a view of warehouses for a product. This view filters out the return and direct delivery warehouses. The default sort (orderby) field is by 'warehouse_name' ascending.

use_for_sales_trading.description: Indicates whether this warehouse is used to sell stock items.

product_sales_figures.description:
Sales trading figures are the quantities and value of goods sold in base currency. These figures are available if a stock item is set to maintain a movement history. Trading figures are not available for phantom BOM built items.

This endpoint has custom filtering on the following fields: 'no_of_periods', 'warehouse_name', 'source_area_reference' and analysis codes 1-20 (analysis_code_n).

periods.description: A collection of sales period trading figures. Periods are expanded by default.

product_purchase_figures.description:
Purchase trading figures are the quantities and value of goods bought in base currency. These figures are available if a stock item is set to maintain a movement history. Trading figures are not available for phantom BOM built items.

This endpoint has custom filtering on the following fields: 'no_of_periods', 'warehouse_name', 'source_area_reference' and analysis codes 1-20 (analysis_code_n).

periods.description: A collection of purchase period trading figures. Periods are expanded by default.

entry_source_type.description:
Entry source types are used to describe the source module that was used to create a movement. Entry source types can be 'EnumEntrySourceTypeStock', 'EnumEntrySourceTypeSOP', 'EnumEntrySourceTypePOP', 'EnumEntrySourceTypeBOM', 'EnumEntrySourceTypeManual'.

The API endpoint returns details of the entry source types that can be used.

source_area_type.description:
Source area types are used to describe the area or account type applicable to a stock transaction. Source area types can be 'EnumSourceAreaTypeSupplier', 'EnumSourceAreaTypeCustomer', 'EnumSourceAreaTypeInternal', 'EnumSourceAreaTypeWriteOff', 'EnumSourceAreaTypeOpeningBalance', 'EnumSourceAreaTypeBOM'.

The API endpoint returns details of the source area types that can be used.

traceable_item_history_record.description: This resource returns a movement history record for a product. There is no default sort (orderby). (Sage 200 Professional only).

trader_reference.description: The trader reference of the product history record.

trader_name.description: The trader name of the product history record.

sales_purchase_order_no.description: The order number of the product history record.

despatch_receipt_grn_no.description: The GRN number of the product history record.

received_issued_date.description: The date of the product history record.

received_issued_by.description: The user that created the product history record.

transaction_history_type.description: The transaction history type of the product history record.

received_issued_quantity.description: The quantity of the product history record.

traceable_item_allocation_record.description: This resource returns a allocation record for a product. There is no default sort (orderby). (Sage 200 Professional only).

warehouse_name.description: The warehouse name of the allocation of a product.

bin_name.description: The bin name within the warehouse of the allocation of a product.

allocated_to.description: The reference of what the product is allocated to.

allocation_date.description: The allocation date of the allocation record.

order_no.description: The order number of the allocation record.

allocated_quantity.description: The allocated quantity of the allocation record.

traceable_item_location_record.description: This resource returns a location record for a product. There is no default sort (orderby). (Sage 200 Professional only).

warehouse_name.description: The warehouse name of the location of a product.

bin_name.description: The bin name within the warehouse of the location of a product.

free_stock_available.description: Total goods in quantity minus goods out quantity minus allocated quantity minus reserved quantity.

bin_quantity_in_stock.description: Quantity in stock for this traceable bin item.

traceable_issue_status_type.description:
Traceable issue status types are used to describe the issued status of traceable items. Traceable issue status types can be 'All', 'Issued Only', or 'Not Issued'.

The API endpoint returns details of the traceable issue status types.

stocktake_criteria_template.description: Stocktake criteria templates are a set of criteria used for auto selection of stock items to add to a stocktake sheet.

last_sold_date.description: Include stock items by the date they were last sold.

due_date.description: Include stock items by when they are due to have a stocktake.

stocktake_traceable_type.description: Include only traceable or non-traceable stock items.

stock_value_type.description: Include stock items by a selected stock value.

stock_value_number_of_items.description: Number of stock items to include on the stocktake.

quantity_from.description: Include stock items by the amount in stock.

quantity_to.description: Include stock items by the amount in stock.

product_groups.description: Include stock items that are associated with these product groups.

stocktake_traceable_type.description:
Stocktake traceable types are used to select stock items by the stock items traceable type to be included on a stocktake. Stocktake traceable types can be 'Non-Traceable', 'Serial Numbered', 'Batch Numbered' or 'Batch and Serial'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake traceable types that can be used.

stocktake_selector_value_type.description:
Stocktake selector value types are used to select stock items by stock value to be included on a stocktake.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake selector value types that can be used.

stocktake_view.description: Gets the collection of stocktakes including warehouse name. The default sort (orderby) field is by 'stocktake_name' ascending.

stocktake_date.description: The created or last updated date of the stocktake, or the current stocktake date if counts have been entered.

stocktake_type_id.description: The type of counting method for the stocktake. E.g. by Stock Item, or by Bin.

stocktake_status_id.description: The current status of the stocktake.

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

stocktake_type.description:
Stocktake method for selecting stocktake items. Stocktake type can be 'By Stock Item', or 'By Bin'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake types that can be used.

stocktake_status_type.description:
Stocktake status types describe the possible states in which a stocktake can be. Stocktake status type can be 'No stocktake', 'Selecting items', 'Sheets printed', 'Entering counts', or 'Complete'.

The API endpoint returns details of the stocktake status types that can be used.

discrepancy_status_type.description:
Discrepancy status types describe the possible states of a stocktake discrepancy. Discrepancy status type can be 'No Discrepancy', 'Discrepancy Found', or 'Discrepancy Resolved'.

The API endpoint returns details of the discrepancy status types that can be used.

stocktake.description: Stocktakes adjust the recorded stock levels in Sage 200 with actual stock levels in order to maintain accurate stock records. Stocktakes are recorded per warehouse. Items for a stocktake can be selected individually (by Stock Item) or by the bin they are stored in.

id.description: Stocktake record Id. Note: This is required for other POST operations that retrieve stocktake records.

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse record Id. Note: This is required for getting a list of items for a new stocktake.

stocktake_date.description: The created or last updated date of the stocktake, or the current stocktake date if counts have been entered.

stocktake_type.description: The type of counting method for the stocktake; e.g. by Stock Item, or by Bin. Note: If other stocktakes exist for the same warehouse, this value can't be changed.

stocktake_status.description: The current status of the stocktake.

exclude_inactive_stock.description: Whether to exclude inactive stock items from the list of items.

show_expected_quantities.description: Whether to show expected quantities when entering counts.

stock_variance_nominal_code_id.description: Stock variance nominal record Id. Note: for setting this, the status must be at Requires Approval.

nominal_narrative.description: The nominal narrative. Note: for setting this, the status must be at Requires Approval.

can_modify_stocktake_type.description: Indicates whether the stocktake type can be changed.

advance_status.description: Whether to advance to the next status.

pre_fill_actual_with_expected.description: Whether to pre-fill actual count values with expected values.

stocktake_items.description: Stocktake items.  Note: this collection is only used when the status is at Selecting Items.

stocktake_item_id.description: Stocktake item record Id. Note: this Id is only set when an item has been selected for a stocktake.

bin_name.description: Bin name. Note: this property is used when the stocktake type is By Bin.

traceable_type.description: The traceable type of the stock item

allows_negative_stock.description: Indicates whether to allow stock levels to go negative from the product group.

stocktake_cycle_period.description: The stocktake cycle number for this stock item.

last_stocktake.description: The date of the last stocktake.

date_of_last_sale.description: The date the stock item was last sold.

is_selected.description: Whether to select the stock item for the stocktake.

failed_stocktake_items.description: Failed Stocktake items. Note: this collection is only used when the status is at Selecting Items.

stocktake_count_sheet_items.description: Stocktake count sheet items. Note: this collection is only used when the status has advanced past Selecting Items.

id.description: Stocktake count sheet item record Id.

include_nos_on_count_sheets.description: Indicates whether individual batch and serial numbers appear on count sheets.

traceable_type.description: The traceable type of the stock item.

costing_method_type.description: The costing method type of the product group.

standard_cost.description: The standard cost of the stock item.

average_buying_price.description: The average buying price of the stock item.

recorded_quantity_in_stock.description: The recorded stock quantity. Note: This is returned only if the stocktakes show_expected_quantity is true.

has_negative_quantity_in_stock.description: Indicates whether recorded stock quantity is negative.

quantity_on_pop_order.description: The quantity on order in POP.

quantity_allocated.description: Total allocated stock, SOP and bom quantity.

actual_quantity_entered.description: Indicates whether actual stock quantity has been entered.

allows_negative_stock.description: Indicates whether to allow stock levels to go negative from the product group.

id.description: Stocktake traceable count sheet item record Id.

stocktake_count_sheet_item_id.description: Stocktake count sheet item record Id.

identification_no.description: The identification number of the traceable item.

pricing_source_type.description:
The pricing source type for product suppliers. Pricing source type can be 'LastBuyingPrice', or 'ListPrice'.

The API endpoint returns details of the pricing source types that can be used.
